Judul: A new diversion drawing technique for controlling ore loss and dilution during longitudinal sublevel caving
Abstrak:
High ore loss and dilution, which are mainly caused by direct contact between blasted ore and caved rock,
generally exist in the process of exploiting inclined medium-thick ore bodies using the sublevel caving method.
An improved diversion drawing technique was proposed with the aim of controlling ore loss and dilution by
changing the flow path and velocity of caved ore and rock. The main function of the diversion structure was to
completely prevent the direct contact between the blasted ore and caved waste rock in the early drawing stage.
Before recovering the diversion structure, there was no waste rock mixed into the blasted ore; thus, the residual
ore near the footwall could be recovered entirely. The original flow path of waste rocks was changed by the
diversion structure and the flow velocity was delayed, preventing premature ore dilution. In addition, the diversion drawing structure reduced the end waste rock mixing in the late drawing stage. A physical drawing
model with a geometric scale of 1:50 was designed and 24 physical simulation experiments were conducted to
compare and analyse the difference in drawing effects between the cut-off grade drawing and the improved
diversion drawing. The research results showed that the improved technique could effectively reduce ore loss
and dilution. Therefore, it can increase the economic benefit of mines and broaden the application scope of the
sublevel caving method.
